sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King a proclamation prohibiting the vse of snaffles, and commanding the vse of bittes for riding. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, Printers to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : M.DC.XXVII [1627]
Arms with 2 leaves under lion's leg. "Giuen at His Maiesties Court at White-Hall, the twentieth day of Nouember, in the third yeere of His Highnesse Reigne of Great Britaine, France and Ireland." Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
=======
By the King a proclamation prohibiting the vse of snaffles, and commanding the vse of bittes for riding. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, Printers to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : M.DC.XXVII [1627]
Arms with 2 leaves under lion's leg. "Giuen at His Maiesties Court at White-Hall, the twentieth day of Nouember, in the third yeere of His Highnesse Reigne of Great Britaine, France and Ireland." Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
Bonham Norton
Iohn Bill
Printers to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie
